Description: 1  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER  P22AS001182  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NO  P22AS00118   FY 2022 PRESERVATION TECHNOLOGY AND TRAINING GRANTS  PTT GRANTS  ARE AWARDED COMPETITIVELY AND ARE INTENDED TO CREATE BETTER TOOLS, MATERIALS, AND APPROACHES TO CONSERVING BUILDINGS, LANDSCAPES, SITES, AND COLLECTIONS  THE PTT GRANTS ARE ADMINISTERED BY THE NATIONAL CENTER FOR PRESERVATION TECHNOLOGY AND TRAINING  NCPTT , THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE S INNOVATION CENTER FOR THE PRESERVATION COMMUNITY 3  PROGRAM GOALS AND BENEFICIARIES  THE PTT COMPETITIVE GRANTS PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO FEDERAL AGENCIES, STATES, TRIBES, LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, AND NON PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS  PTT GRANTS WILL SUPPORT THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES INNOVATIVE RESEARCH THAT DEVELOPS NEW TECHNOLOGIES OR ADAPTS EXISTING TECHNOLOGIES TO PRESERVE CULTURAL RESOURCESSPECIALIZED WORKSHOPS OR SYMPOSIA THAT IDENTIFY AND ADDRESS NATIONAL PRESERVATION NEEDSHOW TO VIDEOS, MOBILE APPLICATIONS, PODCASTS, BEST PRACTICES PUBLICATIONS, OR WEBINARS THAT DISSEMINATE PRACTICAL PRESERVATION METHODS OR PROVIDE BETTER TOOLS FOR PRESERVATION PRACTICETHE RESEARCH PROJECT IN THIS APPLICATION WILL BE CONDUCTED IN TWO PHASES  THE FIRST PHASE FOCUSES ON THOROUGHLY RESEARCHING OXIDATION AND EFFLORESCENCE MECHANISMS OF ELEMENTAL SULFUR IN ORGANIC MATERIALS, ALONE AND COMBINED WITH POLYETHYLENE GLYCOL CONSOLIDANTS  FOR THIS PURPOSE, A LITERATURE REVIEW WILL BE COMPILED, AND THEN EXPERIMENTS WILL BE DEVELOPED AND CONDUCTED  THIS PHASE REQUIRES HIRING A CONSERVATION SCIENCE RESEARCHER STUDENT FOR A TWELVE WEEK PERIOD THE SECOND PHASE WILL FOCUS ON THE REMOVAL OF ELEMENTAL SULFUR FROM WATERLOGGED ORGANICS  DESIGN AND IMPLEMENTATION OF EXPERIMENTS WILL BE BASED ON THE RESULTS OF THE FIRST PHASE  THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT THE PUBLIC IN TWO WAYS   1  DETERMINE NEW TECHNIQUES TO IMPROVE PRESERVATION OF ORGANIC COLLECTIONS, THEREBY BENEFITING THE CONSERVATION PROFESSION  AND  2  PRESERVING COLLECTIONS FOR ENGAGEMENT, PROVIDING A BENEFIT THAT IS UNIQUE TO THE MUSEUM FIELD CONTEXT  PROVIDING CONTEXT IS THE PROCESS OF USING ARTIFACTS TO ENGAGE THE PUBLIC, HELPING TO INCREASE THEIR UNDERSTANDING OF COMPLEX IDEAS

1  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER  P22AS001182  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NO  P22AS00118   FY 2022 PRESERVATION TECHNOLOGY AND TRAINING GRANTS  PTT GRANTS  ARE AWARDED COMPETITIVELY AND ARE INTENDED TO CREATE BETTER TOOLS, MATERIALS, AND APPROACHES TO CONSERVING BUILDINGS, LANDSCAPES, SITES, AND COLLECTIONS  THE PTT GRANTS ARE ADMINISTERED BY THE NATIONAL CENTER FOR PRESERVATION TECHNOLOGY AND TRAINING  NCPTT , THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE S INNOVATION CENTER FOR THE PRESERVATION COMMUNITY 3  PROGRAM GOALS AND BENEFICIARIES  THE PTT COMPETITIVE GRANTS PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO FEDERAL AGENCIES, STATES, TRIBES, LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, AND NON PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS  PTT GRANTS WILL SUPPORT THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES INNOVATIVE RESEARCH THAT DEVELOPS NEW TECHNOLOGIES OR ADAPTS EXISTING TECHNOLOGIES TO PRESERVE CULTURAL RESOURCESSPECIALIZED WORKSHOPS OR SYMPOSIA THAT IDENTIFY AND ADDRESS NATIONAL PRESERVATION NEEDSHOW TO VIDEOS, MOBILE APPLICATIONS, PODCASTS, BEST PRACTICES PUBLICATIONS, OR WEBINARS THAT DISSEMINATE PRACTICAL PRESERVATION METHODS OR PROVIDE BETTER TOOLS FOR PRESERVATION PRACTICETHE KENTUCKY HISTORIC ENVIRONMENTS SPATIAL DATA REPOSITORY  KHESDR  WILL DEVELOP A HABS STYLE DOCUMENTATION PROGRAM THAT USES EVOLVING DIGITAL DOCUMENTATION TECHNOLOGIES  THE KHESDR WILL EMPHASIZE CREATING 3 D DIGITAL MODELS OF HISTORIC BUILDINGS AND LANDSCAPE ELEMENTS AND WILL INCLUDE SUPPLEMENTARY PHOTOGRAPHS  THE DIGITAL DATA REPOSITORY WILL CONSIST OF A CURATED PUBLIC FACING WEBSITE WHERE USERS CAN ARCHIVE DIGITAL REPRESENTATIONS OF DEFINED CATEGORIES OF THE HISTORIC BUILT ENVIRONMENT  THE KHESDR WILL FOSTER COLLABORATIVE AND INTERDISCIPLINARY RESEARCH AND SERVE AS A PUBLIC ARCHIVE OF KENTUCKY S HISTORIC BUILT ENVIRONMENT  THE NATURE OF THE KHESDR, WHICH INCORPORATES PUBLIC PARTICIPATION, REQUIRES A COMMUNITY OF PRESERVATIONISTS AND VOLUNTEERS TO WORK TOGETHER AND SHARE DATA  RESEARCHERS MUST ESTABLISH A PROTOCOL THAT UNDERSTANDS THE LIMITATIONS OF INFORMATION PRODUCED VIA DIFFERENT TOOLS AND METHODS AVAILABLE TO STAKEHOLDERS FOR DATA TO BE MEANINGFUL  DURING THE INITIAL PHASE, THE UNIVERSITY OF KENTUCKY S DEPARTMENT OF HISTORIC PRESERVATION SEEKS TO OBTAIN AND TEST THE EQUIPMENT NECESSARY TO CREATE DIGITAL MODELS OF A HISTORIC LOG STRUCTURE  INVESTIGATORS WILL EVALUATE MODELS BASED ON POINT CLOUDS CREATED BY TWO INSTRUMENTS  A BENCHMARK PRODUCT  FARO FOCUS S 3D SCANNER  AND A CONSUMER GRADE PRODUCT  A LIDAR ENABLED IPAD   MODELS CREATED USING THE TWO LIDAR TECHNOLOGIES AND A THIRD USING THE IPAD S PHOTOGRAMMETRY CAPABILITIES WILL BE COMPARED TO ASSESS THE BENEFITS AND LIMITATIONS OF EACH METHOD  THIS COMPARATIVE STUDY WILL HELP THE INVESTIGATORS EVALUATE THE DIFFERENCES BETWEEN DATA COLLECTION METHODS TO GUIDE THE DATABASE CREATION AND COLLECTION PROTOCOLS IN FUTURE PROJECT PHASES  THE KHESDR WILL CREATE A REPLICABLE MODEL FOR PUBLIC PARTICIPATION IN DIGITAL HERITAGE DOCUMENTATION

1  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER  P22AS001182  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NO  P22AS00118   FY 2022 PRESERVATION TECHNOLOGY AND TRAINING GRANTS  PTT GRANTS  ARE AWARDED COMPETITIVELY AND ARE INTENDED TO CREATE BETTER TOOLS, MATERIALS, AND APPROACHES TO CONSERVING BUILDINGS, LANDSCAPES, SITES, AND COLLECTIONS  THE PTT GRANTS ARE ADMINISTERED BY THE NATIONAL CENTER FOR PRESERVATION TECHNOLOGY AND TRAINING  NCPTT , THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE S INNOVATION CENTER FOR THE PRESERVATION COMMUNITY 3  PROGRAM GOALS AND BENEFICIARIES  THE PTT COMPETITIVE GRANTS PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO FEDERAL AGENCIES, STATES, TRIBES, LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, AND NON PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS  PTT GRANTS WILL SUPPORT THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES INNOVATIVE RESEARCH THAT DEVELOPS NEW TECHNOLOGIES OR ADAPTS EXISTING TECHNOLOGIES TO PRESERVE CULTURAL RESOURCESSPECIALIZED WORKSHOPS OR SYMPOSIA THAT IDENTIFY AND ADDRESS NATIONAL PRESERVATION NEEDSHOW TO VIDEOS, MOBILE APPLICATIONS, PODCASTS, BEST PRACTICES PUBLICATIONS, OR WEBINARS THAT DISSEMINATE PRACTICAL PRESERVATION METHODS OR PROVIDE BETTER TOOLS FOR PRESERVATION PRACTICEFOLLOWING THE TRAGIC FIRE AT NOTRE DAME CATHEDRAL IN PARIS, ARCHITECT, CONSERVATORS, ART HISTORIANS, AND RESEARCHERS BEGAN TO EXPLORE INNOVATIVE TECHNIQUES FOR DOCUMENTING HISTORICAL CULTURE RESOURCES  TERRESTRIAL LASER SCANNING PROVIDES AN EXCITING OPPORTUNITY TO AUGMENT EXISTING RECORDING AND MEASUREMENT METHODS AND OFFERS NEW WAYS OF DISPLAYING AND PRESENTING SPATIAL RELATIONSHIPS  A BUILDING INFORMATION MODELING  BIM  CREATED BASED ON LASER SCAN DATA CAN PROVIDE THE AS BUILT CONDITIONS AND VIRTUAL REALITY ENVIRONMENT FOR HISTORICAL PRESERVATION AND EXHIBITION  THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE AN INNOVATIVE TECHNIQUE OF SCAN TO BIM TO DOCUMENT THE AS BUILT CONDITIONS AND PROVIDE A VIRTUAL REALITY ENVIRONMENT FOR HISTORICAL CONSERVATION AND EXHIBITION  THE OLD FAITHFUL INN IN YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK IS SELECTED AS A SAMPLE PROJECT TO DEMONSTRATE THE PROCESS  PRESERVATIONISTS AND ARCHITECTS CAN UTILIZE THE BIM MODEL AND POINT CLOUD DATA TO IMPROVE RESTORING, PRESERVING, AND PROTECTING THE STRUCTURE  A COST BENEFIT ANALYSIS OF SCAN TO BIM METHOD WILL BE PROVIDED FOR FUTURE REFERENCE  THE TECHNIQUE AND PRACTICE DEVELOPED IN THIS PROJECT CAN BE WIDELY APPLIED FOR PRESERVING AND DOCUMENTING ANY OTHER HISTORICAL BUILDING

1  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER  P22AS001182  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NO  P22AS00118   FY 2022 PRESERVATION TECHNOLOGY AND TRAINING GRANTS  PTT GRANTS  ARE AWARDED COMPETITIVELY AND ARE INTENDED TO CREATE BETTER TOOLS, MATERIALS, AND APPROACHES TO CONSERVING BUILDINGS, LANDSCAPES, SITES, AND COLLECTIONS  THE PTT GRANTS ARE ADMINISTERED BY THE NATIONAL CENTER FOR PRESERVATION TECHNOLOGY AND TRAINING  NCPTT , THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE S INNOVATION CENTER FOR THE PRESERVATION COMMUNITY 3  PROGRAM GOALS AND BENEFICIARIES  THE PTT COMPETITIVE GRANTS PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO FEDERAL AGENCIES, STATES, TRIBES, LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, AND NON PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS  PTT GRANTS WILL SUPPORT THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES INNOVATIVE RESEARCH THAT DEVELOPS NEW TECHNOLOGIES OR ADAPTS EXISTING TECHNOLOGIES TO PRESERVE CULTURAL RESOURCESSPECIALIZED WORKSHOPS OR SYMPOSIA THAT IDENTIFY AND ADDRESS NATIONAL PRESERVATION NEEDSHOW TO VIDEOS, MOBILE APPLICATIONS, PODCASTS, BEST PRACTICES PUBLICATIONS, OR WEBINARS THAT DISSEMINATE PRACTICAL PRESERVATION METHODS OR PROVIDE BETTER TOOLS FOR PRESERVATION PRACTICETHIS PROJECT WILL DEVELOP AN ARCHAEOLOGICAL SITE MODEL FOR THE SABINE NATIONAL FOREST  SNF  IN COLLABORATION WITH NATIONAL FORESTS AND GRASSLANDS IN TEXAS  NFGT   NATIONAL FORESTS IN MISSISSIPPI HAVE BEEN HEAVILY IMPACTED BY THE SOUTHERN PINE BEETLE  SPB  WITH THE CURRENT OUTBREAK NOW IN LOUISIANA  SNF WILL LIKELY BE THE FIRST NFGT PROPERTY IMPACTED AS IT LIES IN THE EASTERNMOST EDGE OF TEXAS  THE PROPOSED MODEL AND MITIGATION PROTOCOL WILL GUIDE DECISION MAKING STRATEGY WHERE A CUT AND LEAVE DECISION WOULD BE TRIGGERED FOR TREES IN LOW PROBABILITY AREAS, AND A CUT AND REMOVE DECISION WOULD BE TRIGGERED IN HIGH PROBABILITY AREAS  THE MODEL S ALSO PROVIDE AN EMPIRICAL AND REPLICABLE METHOD THAT NFGT, SNF, AND CONTRACTED ARCHAEOLOGISTS CAN USE TO ITERATIVELY TEST AND REFINE PREHISTORIC AND HISTORIC INTERPRETATIONS REGARDING LAND USE AND POTENTIAL TEMPORAL AFFILIATION S  THIS CREATES AN EFFICIENT, DATA DRIVEN, AND INFORMED MEANS OF DESIGNATING AREAS OF INCREASED SITE POTENTIAL WHILE FOSTERING SUBSTANTIVE, AND TESTABLE, INTERPRETIVE GAINS

1  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER  P22AS001182  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NO  P22AS00118   FY 2022 PRESERVATION TECHNOLOGY AND TRAINING GRANTS  PTT GRANTS  ARE AWARDED COMPETITIVELY AND ARE INTENDED TO CREATE BETTER TOOLS, MATERIALS, AND APPROACHES TO CONSERVING BUILDINGS, LANDSCAPES, SITES, AND COLLECTIONS  THE PTT GRANTS ARE ADMINISTERED BY THE NATIONAL CENTER FOR PRESERVATION TECHNOLOGY AND TRAINING  NCPTT , THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE S INNOVATION CENTER FOR THE PRESERVATION COMMUNITY 3  PROGRAM GOALS AND BENEFICIARIES  THE PTT COMPETITIVE GRANTS PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO FEDERAL AGENCIES, STATES, TRIBES, LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, AND NON PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS  PTT GRANTS WILL SUPPORT THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES INNOVATIVE RESEARCH THAT DEVELOPS NEW TECHNOLOGIES OR ADAPTS EXISTING TECHNOLOGIES TO PRESERVE CULTURAL RESOURCESSPECIALIZED WORKSHOPS OR SYMPOSIA THAT IDENTIFY AND ADDRESS NATIONAL PRESERVATION NEEDSHOW TO VIDEOS, MOBILE APPLICATIONS, PODCASTS, BEST PRACTICES PUBLICATIONS, OR WEBINARS THAT DISSEMINATE PRACTICAL PRESERVATION METHODS OR PROVIDE BETTER TOOLS FOR PRESERVATION PRACTICEFUNDING WILL SUPPORT A THREE WEEK WORKSHOP IN TERRESTRIAL LIDAR SCANNING, GIS ANALYSIS OF SEA LEVEL RISE, EROSION MITIGATION ANALYSIS, AND PUBLIC INTERPRETATION FOR HERITAGE AT RISK AT EGMONT KEY, FL  THE ISLAND SERVES AS A LIVING LABORATORY OF COASTAL HERITAGE AT RISK, WITH HISTORIC LANDSCAPES ENDANGERED BY SEA LEVEL RISE  THESE THREATS ARE A MICROCOSM OF BROADER TRENDS SEEN IN COASTAL SITES NATIONWIDE  THE TRAINING WORKSHOP WILL CULTIVATE THE NEXT GENERATION OF PROFESSIONALS TO CHAMPION CULTURAL HERITAGE PRESERVATION AND COASTAL RESILIENCE AND FOSTER A COMMUNITY OF PRACTICE AROUND INNOVATIVE, TECHNOLOGY DRIVEN APPROACHES TO DISASTER PLANNING AND RESPONSE

1  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER  P22AS001182  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NO  P22AS00118   FY 2022 PRESERVATION TECHNOLOGY AND TRAINING GRANTS  PTT GRANTS  ARE AWARDED COMPETITIVELY AND ARE INTENDED TO CREATE BETTER TOOLS, MATERIALS, AND APPROACHES TO CONSERVING BUILDINGS, LANDSCAPES, SITES, AND COLLECTIONS  THE PTT GRANTS ARE ADMINISTERED BY THE NATIONAL CENTER FOR PRESERVATION TECHNOLOGY AND TRAINING  NCPTT , THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE S INNOVATION CENTER FOR THE PRESERVATION COMMUNITY 3  PROGRAM GOALS AND BENEFICIARIES  THE PTT COMPETITIVE GRANTS PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO FEDERAL AGENCIES, STATES, TRIBES, LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, AND NON PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS  PTT GRANTS WILL SUPPORT THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES INNOVATIVE RESEARCH THAT DEVELOPS NEW TECHNOLOGIES OR ADAPTS EXISTING TECHNOLOGIES TO PRESERVE CULTURAL RESOURCESSPECIALIZED WORKSHOPS OR SYMPOSIA THAT IDENTIFY AND ADDRESS NATIONAL PRESERVATION NEEDSHOW TO VIDEOS, MOBILE APPLICATIONS, PODCASTS, BEST PRACTICES PUBLICATIONS, OR WEBINARS THAT DISSEMINATE PRACTICAL PRESERVATION METHODS OR PROVIDE BETTER TOOLS FOR PRESERVATION PRACTICETHIS PROJECT WILL COORDINATE AND FILM HISTORIC TRADES INSTRUCTIONAL AND DEMONSTRATION VIDEOS WITH SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTS  THE CAMPAIGN FOR HISTORIC TRADES IS BUILDING AN OPEN SOURCE TRAINING CURRICULUM FOR TRADES TRAINING AND HAS IDENTIFIED A GREAT NEED FOR ACCURATE, HIGH QUALITY, AND DETAILED INSTRUCTIONAL VIDEOS TO BOLSTER THESE CURRICULUM RESOURCES  ADDITIONALLY, MANY EXISTING VIDEOS HAVE COPYRIGHT REGULATIONS AND ARE NOT DESIGNED TO BE 508 COMPLIANT  IF WE ARE TO MAKE TRULY OPEN SOURCE CURRICULUM, THE CAMPAIGN WILL HAVE TO CREATE MUCH OF THIS MATERIAL FOR THE PUBLIC TO USE AND PROMOTE FOR TRAINING RESOURCES

1  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER  P22AS001182  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NO  P22AS00118   FY 2022 PRESERVATION TECHNOLOGY AND TRAINING GRANTS  PTT GRANTS  ARE AWARDED COMPETITIVELY AND ARE INTENDED TO CREATE BETTER TOOLS, MATERIALS, AND APPROACHES TO CONSERVING BUILDINGS, LANDSCAPES, SITES, AND COLLECTIONS  THE PTT GRANTS ARE ADMINISTERED BY THE NATIONAL CENTER FOR PRESERVATION TECHNOLOGY AND TRAINING  NCPTT , THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE S INNOVATION CENTER FOR THE PRESERVATION COMMUNITY 3  PROGRAM GOALS AND BENEFICIARIES  THE PTT COMPETITIVE GRANTS PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO FEDERAL AGENCIES, STATES, TRIBES, LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, AND NON PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS  PTT GRANTS WILL SUPPORT THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES INNOVATIVE RESEARCH THAT DEVELOPS NEW TECHNOLOGIES OR ADAPTS EXISTING TECHNOLOGIES TO PRESERVE CULTURAL RESOURCESSPECIALIZED WORKSHOPS OR SYMPOSIA THAT IDENTIFY AND ADDRESS NATIONAL PRESERVATION NEEDSHOW TO VIDEOS, MOBILE APPLICATIONS, PODCASTS, BEST PRACTICES PUBLICATIONS, OR WEBINARS THAT DISSEMINATE PRACTICAL PRESERVATION METHODS OR PROVIDE BETTER TOOLS FOR PRESERVATION PRACTICEWORKING IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE SMITHSONIAN INSTITUTION AND THE SMITHSONIAN ENVIRONMENTAL RESEARCH CENTER  SERC , STUDENTS, FACULTY, AND A VISITING RESEARCHER FROM THE GEORGIA INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY S SCHOOL OF ARCHITECTURE WILL DOCUMENT AND MODEL THE HISTORIC SELLMAN TENANT FARM DWELLING, LIKELY COMPOSED OF TWO OR MORE ENSLAVED CABINS  ORIGINALLY PART OF SHAW S FOLLY, THE SELLMANS PURCHASED THE LAND IN 1727 AND IT HAS BEEN IN CONTINUOUS  IN THE LATE EIGHTEENTH AND MUCH OF THE NINETEENTH CENTURIES, THE SELLMANS LARGELY RELIED ON ENSLAVED LABOR TO PRODUCE TOBACCO, WHEAT, AND CORN ON THE PROPERTY  A TENANT HOUSE CAME INTO THE SMITHSONIAN S BUILDING INVENTORY IN FEBRUARY 2021 AND NOW THERE IS AN OPPORTUNITY TO EXPLORE IF THE BUILDING IS MADE FROM COMBINED OR SALVAGED ELEMENTS OF THE FORMER ENSLAVED CABINS  ALTHOUGH THERE ARE SOME MODERN MATERIALS ON THE EXTERIOR, THE TENANT FARM WAS NEVER CONDITIONED OR ELECTRIFIED THEREFORE MUCH OF THE STRUCTURE REMAINS INTACT FOR A CLOSE STUDY OF ITS CONSTRUCTION TECHNOLOGY AND BUILDING SEQUENCE  THIS PROJECT WILL EXPLORE HOW A HERITAGE BIM MODEL CAN BE USED TO  1  BETTER RECORD AND STUDY THE STRUCTURE TO UNDERSTAND ITS ORIGINS AND FABRICATION METHODS,  2  DEVELOP AN INTERACTIVE, ARCHETYPAL MODEL OF AN ENSLAVED CABIN FROM THE ERA,  3  FORM A CURATORIAL ASSET TO DOCUMENT THE STRUCTURE S STABILITY AND NECESSARY INTERVENTIONS TO ENSURE ITS PRESERVATION,  4  HOW TO SHOWCASE THE DIGITAL MODEL AND BUILD AN INTERACTIVE PLATFORM FOR A PUBLIC AUDIENCE TO BETTER UNDERSTAND THE PROPERTY FOR BOTH ON SITE AND REMOTE VISITORS

1  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER  P22AS001182  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NO  P22AS00118   FY 2022 PRESERVATION TECHNOLOGY AND TRAINING GRANTS  PTT GRANTS  ARE AWARDED COMPETITIVELY AND ARE INTENDED TO CREATE BETTER TOOLS, MATERIALS, AND APPROACHES TO CONSERVING BUILDINGS, LANDSCAPES, SITES, AND COLLECTIONS  THE PTT GRANTS ARE ADMINISTERED BY THE NATIONAL CENTER FOR PRESERVATION TECHNOLOGY AND TRAINING  NCPTT , THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE S INNOVATION CENTER FOR THE PRESERVATION COMMUNITY 3  PROGRAM GOALS AND BENEFICIARIES  THE PTT COMPETITIVE GRANTS PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO FEDERAL AGENCIES, STATES, TRIBES, LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, AND NON PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS  PTT GRANTS WILL SUPPORT THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES INNOVATIVE RESEARCH THAT DEVELOPS NEW TECHNOLOGIES OR ADAPTS EXISTING TECHNOLOGIES TO PRESERVE CULTURAL RESOURCESSPECIALIZED WORKSHOPS OR SYMPOSIA THAT IDENTIFY AND ADDRESS NATIONAL PRESERVATION NEEDSHOW TO VIDEOS, MOBILE APPLICATIONS, PODCASTS, BEST PRACTICES PUBLICATIONS, OR WEBINARS THAT DISSEMINATE PRACTICAL PRESERVATION METHODS OR PROVIDE BETTER TOOLS FOR PRESERVATION PRACTICETHIS RESEARCH PROJECT WILL EXPLOIT CUTTING EDGE TOOLS AND TECHNOLOGY TO ADAPT THE LATEST LUMINESCENCE DATING TECHNIQUES TO ADOBE BLOCK BUILDINGS  THESE NEW DATING TECHNIQUES NOT ONLY HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO DETERMINE THE TIME OF CONSTRUCTION AND MODIFICATION OF ADOBE BUILDINGS, BUT ALSO TO INFORM CURRENT PRESERVATION AND REHABILITATION PROTOCOLS SO THAT IMPORTANT CHRONOLOGICAL INFORMATION PRESERVED IN ORIGINAL ADOBE BLOCK BUILDINGS IS NOT LOST

1  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER  P22AS001182  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS  FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NO  P22AS00118   FY 2022 PRESERVATION TECHNOLOGY AND TRAINING GRANTS  PTT GRANTS  ARE AWARDED COMPETITIVELY AND ARE INTENDED TO CREATE BETTER TOOLS, MATERIALS, AND APPROACHES TO CONSERVING BUILDINGS, LANDSCAPES, SITES, AND COLLECTIONS  THE PTT GRANTS ARE ADMINISTERED BY THE NATIONAL CENTER FOR PRESERVATION TECHNOLOGY AND TRAINING  NCPTT , THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE S INNOVATION CENTER FOR THE PRESERVATION COMMUNITY 3  PROGRAM GOALS AND BENEFICIARIES  THE PTT COMPETITIVE GRANTS PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO FEDERAL AGENCIES, STATES, TRIBES, LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, AND NON PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS  PTT GRANTS WILL SUPPORT THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES INNOVATIVE RESEARCH THAT DEVELOPS NEW TECHNOLOGIES OR ADAPTS EXISTING TECHNOLOGIES TO PRESERVE CULTURAL RESOURCESSPECIALIZED WORKSHOPS OR SYMPOSIA THAT IDENTIFY AND ADDRESS NATIONAL PRESERVATION NEEDSHOW TO VIDEOS, MOBILE APPLICATIONS, PODCASTS, BEST PRACTICES PUBLICATIONS, OR WEBINARS THAT DISSEMINATE PRACTICAL PRESERVATION METHODS OR PROVIDE BETTER TOOLS FOR PRESERVATION PRACTICEA NEW INSTRUMENT FOR NON DESTRUCTIVE SURFACE ANALYSIS, THE MIRAGE O PTIR MICROSCOPE, EMPLOYS OPTICAL PHOTOTHERMAL INFRARED WITH SIMULTANEOUS IR RAMAN SPECTROSCOPIES AT NANOMETRIC SPATIAL RESOLUTIONS TO CHARACTERIZE INORGANIC AND ORGANIC PARTICLES WITH NO SURFACE CONTACT OR SAMPLE PREPARATION REQUIRED  IT IS A MAJOR ADVANCE FOR DOCUMENTATION OF ARCHAEOLOGICAL CERAMIC SHERDS, ENABLING IDENTIFICATION AND MICRO MAPPING OF CRYSTALLINE AND AMORPHOUS PHASES IN SURFACE DECORATIONS AND BURIAL ACCRETIONS TO ADDRESS ANTHROPOLOGICAL AND CONSERVATION TREATMENT QUESTIONS  THE AIM OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DEMONSTRATE THE USEFULNESS OF MIRAGE O PTIR MICROSCOPY FOR ANALYSIS OF SUB MICRON PHASES IN ARCHAEOLOGICAL CERAMIC SURFACE DECORATIVE LAYERS SUCH AS SLIPS, PAINTS, AND GLAZES  THIS PROGRAM WILL BENEFIT MULTIPLE APPLICATIONS IN THE CONSERVATION COMMUNITY

THE PURPOSES OF THE CENTER SHALL BE TO   1  DEVELOP AND DISTRIBUTE PRESERVATION AND CONSERVATION SKILLS AND TECHNOLOGIES FOR THE IDENTIFICATION, EVALUATION, CONSERVATION, AND INTERPRETATION OF HISTORIC PROPERTY   2  DEVELOP AND FACILITATE TRAINING FOR FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL RESOURCE PRESERVATION PROFESSIONALS, CULTURAL RESOURCE MANAGERS, MAINTENANCE PERSONNEL, AND OTHERS WORKING IN THE PRESERVATION FIELD   3  TAKE STEPS TO APPLY PRESERVATION TECHNOLOGY BENEFITS FROM ONGOING RESEARCH BY OTHER AGENCIES AND INSTITUTIONS   4  FACILITATE THE TRANSFER OF PRESERVATION TECHNOLOGY AMONG FEDERAL AGENCIES, STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, UNIVERSITIES, INTERNATIONAL ORGANIZATIONS, AND THE PRIVATE SECTOR  AND  5  COOPERATE WITH RELATED INTERNATIONAL ORGANIZATIONS INCLUDING THE INTERNATIONAL COUNCIL ON MONUMENTS AND SITES, THE INTERNATIONAL CENTER FOR THE STUDY OF PRESERVATION AND RESTORATION OF CULTURAL PROPERTY, AND THE INTERNATIONAL COUNCIL ON MUSEUMS

THE NATIONAL CENTER FOR PRESERVATION TECHNOLOGY AND TRAINING  NCPTT  SERVES A PURPOSE TO DEVELOP AND DISTRIBUTE PRESERVATION AND CONSERVATION SKILLS AND TECHNOLOGIES FOR THE IDENTIFICATION, EVALUATION, CONSERVATION, AND INTERPRETATION OF HISTORIC PROPERTY  THE NCPTT ALSO SERVES TO DEVELOP AND FACILITATE TRAINING FOR FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL RESOURCE PRESERVATION PROFESSIONALS, CULTURAL RESOURCE MANAGERS, MAINTENANCE PERSONNEL, AND OTHERS WORKING IN THE PRESERVATION FIELD  THESE ACTIONS LEAD TO TAKING STEPS TO APPLY PRESERVATION TECHNOLOGY BENEFITS FROM ONGOING RESEARCH BY OTHER AGENCIES AND INSTITUTIONS  THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DOCUMENT THE VANISHING VERNACULAR FORM OF FARM LABOR HOUSES IN AMERICA  BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE U S  UNIVERSITIES AND TWO AND FOUR YEAR COLLEGES  U S  PRIVATE NONPROFIT INSTITUTION ORGANIZATIONS AND QUASI PUBLIC NONPROFIT INSTITUTION ORGANIZATIONS THAT ARE DIRECTLY ASSOCIATED WITH EDUCATIONAL OR RESEARCH ACTIVITY  FEDERAL, STATE, LOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES, FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED INDIAN TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS AND THEIR TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICES

OBJECTIVES  DEVELOP INTERNSHIPS AND TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES  DEVELOP COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENTS PROGRAMS  DEVELOP KNOWLEDGE DISSEMINATION CHANNELS OR MEDIA TO ASSIST AND DEVELOP UNDERSTANDING BETWEEN THE US AND INTERNATIONAL PRESERVATION CONSERVATION COMMUNITY  JOINTLY ASSIST AND MUTUALLY SUPPORT ICOMOS AND UNESCO MISSIONS WHERE APPLICABLE GOALS  CREATING OPPORTUNITIES FOR PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT BOTH NATIONALLY AND INTERNATIONALLY  DEVELOPING OPPORTUNITIES FOR INTERNATIONAL EXCHANGE FOR THE PRESERVATION AND CONSERVATION COMMUNITY DEVELOPING NETWORKS OF PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE FOR THE PRESERVATION AND CONSERVATION COMMUNITY  DEVELOPING OPPORTUNITIES FOR PROFESSIONAL DISCOURSE  DEVELOPING NEW OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE EXCHANGE OF NEW CONSERVATION AND PRESERVATION KNOWLEDGE, METHODS, TECHNOLOGIES, AND TECHNIQUES SUCH AS BY RAISING AWARENESS AND DISSEMINATING PUBLICATIONS, MEDIA ETC  SUPPORTING ICOMOS MISSION TO DEVELOP INTERNATIONAL RELATIONS AND EXCHANGE AS WELL AS ANY TECHNICAL SUPPORT NECESSARY FOR THE EXCHANGE OF KNOWLEDGE AND GUIDANCE TO UNESCO WORLD HERITAGE BODY
